entry.title: Botanical Watercolor 2
entry.content:
NOTE: NO CLASS APRIL 14

Building on skills and concepts introduced in Botanical Watercolor 1, this class will focus on realistic expression of form, structure, texture, and color using wash and dry brush watercolor techniques. Students will work from simple plant forms e.g. gourds, fruit, and leaves


Instructor: Elaine Hultgren
Limit: 15


RED BUTTE GARDEN REFUND AND CANCELLATION POLICY


Materials List

  • Transparent Watercolors - Recommended Winsor Newton Artists’ grade (Not Cotman)
    • Either 5 ml or 14/15 ml size:
    • Winsor Lemon – (cool)
    • Cadmium Yellow Pale –(warm) or Cadmium Yellow (warm)
    • Winsor Blue RS (Red Shade) – (warm) or Ultramarine Blue (warm)
    • Winsor Blue GS (Green Shade) - (cool)
    • Quinacridone Magenta – (cool) or Permanent Rose (cool)
    • Cadmium Red – (warm)

  • Brushes: Sceptre Gold recommended for beginners and intermediates: one each – Sceptre Gold II size 2 and 5, or Kolinsky sables: Raphael 8404 Brand: size 1 and 4 or Winsor Newton Series 7 brand: size 2 and 4.
    • NOTE: Utrecht Art Supply (in Sugarhouse) has Red Sable brushes.

  • Optional but good: “The Masters” Brush cleaner, a cake soluble with water.

  • Detail Brush: A specialty brush you must order online BUT sometimes available at art stores. I use a Dick Blick brand: size 2 Studio Sable, Kolinsky Sable Detail. Also available: size 3 Winsor Newton Miniature Kolinsky Sable. Detail brushes have shorter hairs but are fuller at the ferrule to hold more paint. This brush used in dry brush stage.

  • Mixing Brush: A #3,4,5 OLD brush you can use to mix colors with. I use a Loew- Cornell round #4 brush I purchased at Michaels craft store.

  • Pencils: 2B, HB, 2H 4H – A blue Col-erase pencil will be provided if you do not have it

  • Tracing Paper: 11x14, Canson, Foundation Series, Red, White, and Black cover, AND can be bought locally only at Hobby Lobby for $8 but there is always a 40% coupon available online. This tracing paper is the most translucent of all such papers.

  • Watercolor Paper: One pack 11x14 140lb Strathmore Ready Cut Hot Press (6 sheets to a pack). One pack costs $6.37 through Dick Blick online. Utrecht (in Sugarhouse) may have it stocked in store. Must be "hot press."

  • Other: Porcelain palette(s): I suggest 7 well Flower Palettes at $4.52 apiece. I suggest an order of 2 from Dick Blick online. There are others you might want in addition.

  • Small round or square white china plate for dry brush painting.

  • “Pentel Clic” white eraser housed in plastic pen like housing. Available at Office Stores.

  • Small grey kneaded eraser

  • Scotch removable tape on Blue plaid card also available at Office Stores

  • An eye dropper

  • Pencil sharpener electric available in class. Bring handheld as they are easier on pencils

  • Small pack or box of KLEENEX or Viva paper towels.

  • 12” ruler

Materials provided to you

  • One portfolio with watercolor information and exercises (watercolor exercise paper provided)

  • Col-Erase 20044 Blue pencil

  • Foam board easel

    • Suggested Books (Helpful to read prior to class):

    “Mixing Greens” by Michael Wilcox
    “Color Mixing Swatch Book” also by Michael Wilcox


    Art Supply locations and links online:

    Blick, Salt Lake City
    1025 East 2100 South
    (801) 832-0400
    www.utrechtart.com


    Dick Blick Art

    www.dickblick.com


    Other Online Art Supply Stores:

    Daniel Smith
    1 (800) 426-6740
    www.danielsmith.com


    Cheap Joe’s Art Stuff

    1(800) 227-2788
    www.cheapjoes.com


    Jerry’s Artarama Art Supplies

    1(800) 827-8478
    www.jerrysartarama.com


    Questions? Email Elaine at ehult@cox.net

entry.title: Botanical Composition & Style
entry.content:
INSTRUCTOR: Natalia Wilkins-Tyler
LIMIT: 15

Imaginative, interesting and dynamic composition can transform a botanical painting or illustration into a masterpiece. It is through composition that you introduce your own personal style into your work. This class helps to explain the elements that go towards creating a good composition and the basic principles underlying a successful illustration. The class will work entirely in graphite pencil, but the principles presented apply to all art media.


RED BUTTE GARDEN REFUND AND CANCELLATION POLICY


Materials List

  1. Graphite Pencils: 6H, 4H, 2H, HB, 2B, 2B, 4B,6B Brand of your choice. Tom Bow brand available only online

  2. Pad of Drawing Paper 11x14 Strathmore recommended available at Blick,Sugarhouse and Michaels 300 series or 400 series.

  3. Pad of tracing paper 11x14 Canson Foundation series, Red White and Black cover and can only be purchased locally at Hobby Lobby for around $8. There is always a 40% discount offered and can be accessed online at cashier.

  4. Pad of Bristol paper 11x14 Strathmore or Canson, Vellum or plate surface finish, 300 or 400 series

  5. Pentel white “Clic” eraser, refillable and available at all office supply stores

  6. A roll of “Scotch” brand “Removable” tape found in office supply stores on a blue plaid cardboard hanger hanging on a tape display

  7. A “kneaded” eraser It is gray and square shaped

  8. A hand held or battery operated pencil sharpener

  9. A roll of white “Artists’ Tape” available at Blick store in Sugarhouse

  10. A make-up or soft basring brush to sweep away eraser particles

  11. Small tortillions-rolled paper smudge sticks also available at Blick store

Materials Provided by Instructor

  • 1 foam board easel

  • A set of view finders

  • A blue sketch pencil

Instructor's Bio

Visit Natalia's Website

Contact Information: 801-581-8454

entry.title: Updates from Around the Garden
entry.content:
As the snow melts and the Garden begins to bloom, life awakens at Red Butte Garden. Our collections of conifers, roses, daffodils, and more are alive with the spirit of spring. The Garden never looked so good!

As the Garden changes colors and forms, so has our website. At Red Butte we worked hard to create a refreshed and streamlined way for you to access our events and information. The new site brings a modern design, enhanced functionality, and a mobile optimized experience for visitors on the go.

With warmer weather on our doorstep, it’s time to plan for the 2017 Outdoor Concert Series. Tickets go on sale for Garden Members online on Monday, April 24th at 7PM and in-person on Tuesday, April 25th. Tickets for the General Public go on sale Monday, May 1st at 9AM both in-person and online. Renew or purchase a Garden-Plus Membership level or above by April 21st in order to participate in the April 24th member-only online presale.

For more information, CLICK HERE

Transform your garden by picking up some new plants at the annual Spring Plant Sale! The members-only day is May 12th, while the general public day is May 13th. You will be able to purchase a range of veggies, heirlooms, roses, trees, shrubs, shade, water-wise, and just plain fun plants. Come check it out!

For more information, CLICK HERE

In other news, the new Water Conservation Garden Grand Opening is May 20th. This inspiring new space will showcase the beauty and diversity of water-wise plants. Enjoy plants of all varieties, each with unique methods of conserving water.

For more information, CLICK HERE

Thank you for your dedication and passion for the Garden. We are excited to introduce you and your family to the beauty of nature.

If you would like to make a donation to the Garden:

We’ll see you soon!

Sincerely,
Red Butte Garden and Arboretum
300 Wakara Way, Salt Lake City, Utah, 84108
entry.summary: As the snow melts and the Garden begins to bloom, life awakens at Red Butte Garden. Our collections of conifers, roses, daffodils, and more are alive with the spirit of spring. The Garden never looked so good!

entry.title: BOTANICAL DRAWING 1
entry.content:
Instructor: Elaine Hultgren
Limit: 15


Class Times

MONDAYS, April 10 - May 15
(no class May 8)
1PM-4PM



Please note: this class is Botanical Drawing 1 (the newsletter listed this class as Botanical Drawing 2)

This is a foundation class that introduces students to the basics of drawing. Students will learn the vocabulary of drawing, develop observation skills, complete a sequence of exercises using graphite as the primary medium, and will be introduced to the technical properties of drawing materials.


MATERIALS LIST

  • Graphite Pencils: 6H, 4H, 2H, HB, 2B, 4B, 6B Brand of your choice
    • Note: Tom Bow pencils available only online.

  • Pad of drawing paper 11x14. Strathmore is available at Utrecht/Blick in Sugarhouse and Michaels. 300 or 400 series. This paper is acid free

  • Pad of tracing paper: 11x14 Canson, Foundation Series, Red, White and black cover and can only be bought at Hobby Lobby for 8.00 but there is always a 40% discount coupon you can apply.

  • Pad of Bristol paper: 11x14 Strathmore or Canson, Vellum or Plate surface finish, 300 or 400 series.

  • Pentel “Clic” eraser found at all office supply stores

  • Kneaded eraser

  • Hand held or battery operated pencil sharpener

  • Roll of Scotch brand “Removable” tape mounted on a Blue Plaid card

  • Roll of white ½ inch “Artists Tape” available at Utrecht/Blick store

  • A makeup or soft basting brush to sweep away eraser particles

  • Tortillions – rolled paper smudge sticks (not needed for 1st class)

  • A good book to purchase: How to Draw Plants, by Keith West

I will have other drawing books for you to look through. If you have questions please e-mail me at ehult@cox.net

Visit Elaine's Website

entry.title: BOTANICAL DRAWING 2
entry.content:
INSTRUCTOR: Elaine Hultgren

REGISTRATION REQUIRED

PHONE REGISTRATION ALSO AVAILABLE: 801-587-5433

LIMIT: 15


Class Time

MONDAYS
JUNE 5 - JULY 10
1PM - 4PM



This class is a continuation of Botanical Drawing 1. Students will refine their observational drawing skills through careful observation of plant structures. Students will learn to accurately draw botanical forms using pencil as the primary medium. Emphasis will be placed on line, form, light & shade, and simple perspective.


MATERIALS LIST

  • Graphite Pencils: 6H, 4H, 2H, HB, 2B, 4B, 6B Brand of your choice. Note: Tom Bow pencils available only online.

  • Pad of drawing paper 11x14. Strathmore is available at Utrecht/Blick in Sugarhouse and Michaels. 300 or 400 series. This paper is acid free

  • Pad of tracing paper: 11x14 Canson, Foundation Series, Red, White and black cover and can only be bought at Hobby Lobby for 8.00 but there is always a 40% discount coupon you can apply.

  • Pad of Bristol paper: 11x14 Strathmore or Canson, Vellum or Plate surface finish, 300 or 400 series.

  • Pentel “Clic” eraser found at all office supply stores

  • Kneaded eraser

  • Hand held or battery operated pencil sharpener

  • Roll of Scotch brand “Removable” tape mounted on a Blue Plaid card

  • Roll of white 1/2 inch “Artists Tape” available at Utrecht/Blick store

  • A makeup or soft basting brush to sweep away eraser particles

  • Tortillions – rolled paper smudge sticks (not needed for 1st class)

  • A good book to purchase: How to Draw Plants, by Keith West

I will have other drawing books for you to look through. If you have questions please e-mail me at ehult@cox.net

entry.title: BIRDING
entry.content:
REGISTRATION REQUIRED BY PHONE: 801-581-8454 (not online)

GUIDE: Arline Sant, Red Butte Garden Naturalist Volunteer

Spring Bird Watching Tour Dates


SATURDAY TOURS from 9-11:30AM
April 22, 29
May 6, 13, 20, 27

WEDNESDAY TOURS from 9-11:30AM
May 17, 31


Enjoy the Garden’s cool morning breezes and join us for a morning walk full of wildlife activity. Bullock’s Oriole, Western Tanager, Downy Woodpecker, and American Gold Finch are just some of the many birds we’re likely to see. Bring your binoculars and drop in for one or more of the scheduled birding walks. Tours are intended for adults. In case of inclement weather, please call: 801-585-0556 to check event status.


Birds of Red Butte Garden

RED BUTTE GARDEN BIRDING BROCHURE

Abundant water in ponds and Red Butte Creek, ample food sources, adequate cover, and protection within the 100 acre Garden attract birds not typically found in the surrounding foothills and neighborhoods.

Want To See More Birds?

Wear muted clothing. Avoid wearing stark white- it can startle away many birds. Speak softly, walk slowly, make no sudden gestures. Stop often or find a shady place to sit and watch.

American Kestrel
Red-breasted Nuthatch
Bullock's Oriole
Western Kingbird

entry.title: VEGETABLE CONTAINER GARDENING
entry.content:
INSTRUCTOR: Michelle Cook

REGISTRATION REQUIRED

PHONE REGISTRATION ALSO AVAILABLE: 801-587-5433

LIFELONG LEARNING CLASS: LLHG 546


Class Time

SATURDAY
MAY 27
10AM - 1PM



Do you lack sufficient sun or garden space for a vegetable or herb garden? Many herbs and vegetables thrive in containers, which can be positioned or moved to take advantage of sunny spots. Learn which vegetables and herbs do well in containers, as well as tips to keep them producing throughout summer and into fall. You will also have the opportunity to plant the vegetables of your choice into a 15-inch container to take home.

entry.title: SUCCULENT CENTERPIECES
entry.content:
INSTRUCTOR: Briana Blamires, Red Butte Garden Grower & Horticulturalist

REGISTRATION REQUIRED

PHONE REGISTRATION ALSO AVAILABLE: 801-587-5433

LIFELONG LEARNING CLASS: LLHG 5895


Class Time

SATURDAY
MAY 20
10AM - Noon



Looking for a centerpiece that is as much at home on the dining room table as it is on the patio or deck? Look no further than the world of succulents! Part lecture, part workshop, this class will first teach general identification, care and propagation techniques of the most popular succulents grown today as well as basic principles of design, followed by a workshop where you will create your very own succulent centerpiece. Tools, container, succulents, and all the encouragement you need will be provided. Co-Sponsored with Lifelong Learning.
entry.summary: INSTRUCTOR: Briana Blamires, Red Butte Garden Grower & Horticulturalist

entry.title: PLEIN AIR LANDSCAPE WORKSHOP
entry.content:
INSTRUCTOR: Richard Vroom, Artist

REGISTRATION REQUIRED

PHONE REGISTRATION ALSO AVAILABLE: 801-587-5433

(LLART 170)


Class Times

TUESDAYS
MAY 16 - JUNE 20
5:30 - 8:30PM



Enjoy the warm summer evenings as you create small-scale landscapes in lovely Red Butte Garden. Students will view demonstrations and receive exercises in washes, blending, wet on wet, lifting, brushstrokes, glazing, and drybrush. Instruction in composition, positive and negative space, value studies, and color theory will round out the offering. Painting topics will include landscapes, still life, and water reflections. You are responsible for your materials; you can find a list online, or call 801-587-5433. Co-sponsored with Lifelong Learning. Members pay $197, ask for section 002. This class is limited to 10.
